campaign.story:
Funded! Now you can order copies of Cadence & Slang on our official site.
"Required reading for any UX Designer I hire. A cornerstone for learning the essence and finesse of interaction design." — Nick Finck, projekt202
"Stunned: this is what Kickstarter was made for." — Diana Kimball, SoundCloud
Cadence & Slang is a very small book about interaction design. It contains a set of evergreen principles that pertain to any kind of work in technology, from websites to iOS apps to native software. There are many great texts about user experience, but people have repeatedly returned to this one for its clarity and its succinct statement of purpose. It's been out of print for a long time, and now you have a chance to grab a copy of your own. If you're new to Cadence & Slang, you can read the first chapter of the second edition for free right now.
As one of Kickstarter's earliest projects, our first edition (depicted above) sold out in 2011. Now, after much demand, Cadence & Slang is back. I need your help in funding a high-quality, hardcover, cloth-bound, letterpressed print run of our second edition – entirely revised, updated, and expanded for 2013. If we get funded, you'll receive a beautifully made book, and the revised PDF six weeks after.
"Once you read it, I think you’ll start sending it to everyone who asks how you became a competent designer." — Max Temkin, Cards Against Humanity
"It doesn't teach design techniques or push ideals. It shows how to use design to serve those ideals." — Marc Noel
What's in the second edition?
Oh, many things!
Since beginning Cadence & Slang in 2008, I've been told that a device called "the iPhone" has become popular. So this edition is revised to focus on touch-based interaction models considerably more.
More focus on the visual side of interaction design, including research-driven thoughts on the debate between skeuomorphic and flat design.
Significantly more emphasis on ethnographic research and contextual inquiry.
And overall, every single section has been touched in some way by a word-for-word edit of the entire manuscript. Unlike the first edition, this edition is professionally edited by one dedicated person.
Who's responsible for all this?
I'm Nick Disabato, but most folks call me nickd. I have seven years of experience in the industry, and as an independent consultant, I have seen all sorts of businesses succeed or fail based on the quality of their user experiences.
I'm working with Kaitlyn Tierney, who is editing this edition; and Daniel Bogan is back with two dozen brand-new illustrations.
And that's it
I hope you'll help me make Cadence & Slang a second time. This has been the best project I've ever worked on, and I'm humbled that it has helped so many people. Thanks for all of your support, and I hope you can spread the word.
Follow @slang on Twitter for updates, or take a look at Cadence & Slang's official site to read the first chapter for free.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
I have spent the past six weeks working full-time on this edition. The manuscript is already finished and in Kaitlyn's hands. Daniel's illustrations are due this week. So, creating it isn't a huge problem.

There are risks in delivering any printed product, but mostly in terms of the deadline. It may take longer than expected to revise the proofs – which, yes, costs additional money – or to deliver the books to you. If your copy arrives damaged, it'll take additional time for me to mail you a replacement. I'll be working with the same printer that made our first edition, so I already have a solid relationship with their team, and they know how to do right by this.

On a personal note, I am also getting married in early November, and I reckon that will take up some chunk of my time in the fall.

updates.update_content:
Hello! Hope you've been well.
I just wanted to let you know that five minutes ago, I released a new course called The A/B Testing Manual. It's a five-hour video course and 220-page book that teaches you how to plan, run, and execute on A/B tests in your organization. More broadly, it's about how to use design research to come up with revenue-generating design decisions.
If you enjoyed the way Cadence & Slang approaches design, you'll probably get a lot of value out of – and on Friday, the price of the book & worksheets will increase. and grab your copy today!

Howdy! It’s been a few years since we last chatted, and I hope you’ve been well. In the meantime, I’ve been making a new book. It’s called Draft Evidence, and it compiles a lot of writings about design, independent business, and life that I think you’ll enjoy.
If you backed Cadence & Slang (and you did, right?), you’re probably going to love Draft Evidence. Take a look at the project page today; I’d really love your support.

Good news! Cadence & Slang's second edition is real. I received two advance copies in the mail this afternoon, and will be receiving the rest of the print run tomorrow.
It looks amazing. I'm so happy with how it turned out, and I can't wait to ship your book to you.
Towards that end, I'll be packing your print copies on Sunday, October 20, and mailing them the following day.

As promised, the tiny reminder.
There's only one day left to preorder Cadence & Slang for $50 (or $58 if you're international). That's the cheapest you'll ever be able to get it for online; after tomorrow night, everyone will have to pay an additional $4 to $12 in shipping.
You have until 5:00 PM Central Time tomorrow to order, so if you think others might enjoy a copy of Cadence & Slang, please point them this way.

Hello! The Kickstarter for Cadence & Slang ends this Friday, at 5PM Central Time. At that point, your card will be charged for your preorder.
People will be able to buy copies of Cadence & Slang on our official site after the Kickstarter is over, but all Kickstarter backers are getting $4 off after shipping and handling costs are factored in. So, you and your friends should order early and often!

I initially got the idea for Uniform when I was at the store one day. I noticed that a lot of products use circular geometric typefaces in conjunction with their condensed counterparts for their packaging, but all of the condensed weights turned the circular characters (like O, C, G) into ovals. Uniform is a 3 width type family that is truly based on the circle and does not become an oval when condensed.

I will also post an exclusive message about once a week to all backers with more detailed info as I'm creating Uniform. campaign.story:
We are Paul, Rich and Ebbe and we have architect problems.
We are tired of looking up dimensions, stupid facts, and sketching out of scale. So we distilled information from design manuals, drew little drawings of things we actually use, combined it with dot grids at 4 different scales and made it into a travel size notebook. 
The A:LOG, designed with a minimalist aesthetic, has a soft letter pressed cover and perfect stitch binding. It features the highest quality paper and a ruler bookmark insert. A:LOG also comes in imperial (US) and metric (International) versions for designers and architects all around the world. It will be an essential tool for you around the office, in meetings, or on site. 
IN THE A:LOG
Part I : Reference Information (30 pages)
1) Design Information such as line weights and font sizes. 
2) Building Elements like door dimensions, window heights.
3) Technical Guidelines such as egress, ADA, and structure.
4) Architecture References like magazines and websites.
5) Living Scenarios of bedroom, kitchen, living room and bathroom.
design information
technical guidelines
living scenarios
We believe that sketching remains a vital tool of how we understand Architecture. To us, Architecture is super fun and often messy so we incorporated user friendly drawings to illustrate daily living scenarios to make Architecture and design accessible to everyone. 
*A:LOG (US version) is the version we are showing in the images and video. A:LOG (International version) is drawn according to international building code, and all measurements are in metric. 
Part II : Dot grids at 4 different scales (130 pages)
*The metric dot grids are in 1:200, 1:100, 1:50, 1:20 scale.

While there are a lot of different dot grid notebooks out there, A:LOG is the only one that provides a diverse range of scales so you can draw plans at a 1/16” and 1/8" scale then draw a detail at a 1/4" or ½” scale all in the same book! The dot grids are especially handy when you are on site, taking dimensions without a ruler. 
BE PART OF PROJECT A:LOG
Whether you are just starting out or you are a professional in the field, as long as you love design and  architecture, you will love A:LOG. With your support, we'd like to gather enough pre-orders to cover the printing costs to get this notebook into your hands. It also makes for a great gift, so we've opened up higher pledges for those of you who want more than one. 
Thank you so much for checking out our project and your support is greatly appreciated! 
Paul, Rich and Ebbe
PS: The A:LOG is selling here for $25 as a limited pre-sale Kickstarter price. After this campaign, A:LOG will retail for $30.
FAQ
Q/ Whats the difference between the US and International A:LOG?
A/ A:LOG (US version) is the version we are showing in the images and video. The guidelines and dot grids are all drawn in feet and inches. A:LOG (International version) is drawn according to international building code and dot grids are at a metric scale. The metric dot grid are in 1:200, 1:100 1:50 1:25 scale. You will be able to specify which version you would like when the project is funded.
Q/ Is shipping included and how does it work?
A/ We are offering free US shipping only. Please add $15 for international shipping. We will send you a form to fill out with your most up to date address when the A:LOG is ready to be shipped, estimated around late August. Don't worry about filling out your address now, we got you!
Q/ Is this the final design of A:LOG?
A/ The A:LOG shown in the video and images is our prototype. We strive to make the best notebook possible and it really depends on your help. The final product will be more refined than our current prototype. Please check our updates to follow the A:LOG development adventure!
Q/ When will you start to ship?
A/ We hope to begin manufacturing as soon as the kickstarter campaign is over and be able to ship the A:LOG to you in the beginning of September!
GOODIES COMING YOUR WAY!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Project A:LOG has been in the works for over a year and we have established great relationships with our manufacturers and design collaborators. Moreover, our design team can't be more excited to get the book printed. We're also familiar with producing all the tier rewards and getting them out on schedule. ...all that being said, we have a small team and the three of us do just about everything. So if an emergency were to arise, it might cause a delay. But we don't anticipate that happening and we will do everything within our means to delivery A:LOG to you on time!

campaign.story:
Jersey + Bibs = New Kit Day
New Kit Day
Announcement: We just relaunched with a new goal amount.  We had it set too high.  We raised this much last time, so let's get this done!
You can choose either version of the Kit. Don't worry about giving us your color or size preferences right now. We'll get all that once we're funded.
There are pictures at the bottom of this page and on our website and Facebook.  Let us know if you have any questions. Thanks for checking out our project and you're rad!
http://www.newkitday.com/
https://www.facebook.com/newkitday
New Kit Day
Our Story
New Kit Day is the creation of Anthony Borba and Eric Chao. We both live and ride in the San Francisco Bay Area. Anthony has been racing bikes in Northern California for many years and Eric is an avid cyclist who is also an amazing designer.
New Kit Day brings fresh designs together with custom kit ordering to provide high quality kits for less than the other high-end bicycle clothing manufacturers.  The awesome part is that we use the same lycras, chamois and technical fabrics they use.
We make everything here in Northern California! 
Printed in San Jose.  Sewn in Oakland.
Why Kickstarter
We are launching our first collection on Kickstarter with the hopes of growing our business and sharing our passion with riders everywhere. The funds we are raising here will go towards fulfilling this kit order and setting up the next kit order.
Industry Experience
Together we bring years of experience in custom bike clothing design and production. Anthony has been managing the design and fulfillment of his team's cycling clothing for years. Eric has been designing some of the best looking kits in the peloton.  We have worked with many of the vendors in the industry.  We know the good materials from the bad. 
New Kit Day hand picks the lycras and high-end chamois for our bib shorts and wicking stretch-poly fabrics for our jerseys. The Chamois is fantastic; perfect density and without bulkiness.  It is truly an all-day riding chamois. More info and photos below.
What's Next
We combine these great materials with awesome designs at reasonable prices because we are ordering on a limited edition basis and working directly with the riders. Essentially, we are creating custom order around each design. Since we fulfill each order the riders get awesome, pro-level gear directly without having to pay the mark-up.
All of our kits will made in small runs and they will be numbered. It will be a lot like getting custom made suit. Our kits are printed in San Jose and sewn in Oakland.  New Kit Day will publish a new design  about once a month and there will be a short early ordering period with freebies like t-shirts, stickers or arm warmers for the first 100 orders.  Once we have 100+ orders, we go into production and a few weeks later it's New Kit Day! 
Every design that reaches 100 orders will also be available to reorder in the New Kit Day Vault.  You can catch a glimpse of some of our future designs at the end of our video.
Fabrics, Lycra and Chamois
The most important components are the materials. We'll let you in on a little secret: There are only a handful of Chamois manufacturers in the world and about dozen good Lycra/Spandex manufacturers.  We use a Cytech Chamois.  This is the same brand you will find in virtually all the high-end bibs on the market.  Here is our actual chamois.  It's same one you may be sitting on right now.  This chamois was chosen by a multiple time national champion road racer for his personal use.  We absolutely love it. 
Our bibshorts are feature a solid medium-weight spandex/polyester blend that has great wicking properties; so the shorts never feel heavy. The stretch-compression of the spandex is high and the pad stays in place.
Our jersey is made from high stretch, wicking polyester and has great features like easy access, non-sagging rear pockets and a full length zipper. It also has a silicon gripper at the bottom, but not on the arm openings.
The Kickstarter Kit & Reward Notes
The first kit we are producing is detailed below.  You may notice some slight design variation between our snap-on form and the photos below.  The actual kit will be marked as Design #1 and will have the lightning bolt rear-pocket.  The Chinese characters on the kit translates to "New Kit Day".
We have a men's and women's versions of the kit.  There is a size chart below.  Both the women's and men's fit similar to other high-end brand likes capo, pearl and others but are not cut tiny like rapha. 
The women's bibs come with a slightly different chamois than the men's (men's is pictured below).  The women's bibs also have a silicon gripper at the leg opening.  The women's jersey is a feminine cut.  Korina is wearing an x-small jersey and small bibs in the pictures.  She is 5'4" and 120 Lbs.
For the men there will be two Jersey styles: Race Cut and Club Cut.  Club Cut is a looser version of the Race Cut, the sizing is the same.  The Bibs will come with the Chamois pictured below and powergripper at the leg opening.  Tony is wearing a medium Race Cut jersey and medium bibs in the pictures.  He is 5'10" and 172 lbs with a 32 inch waist.
Once our project is funded, we will gather all the details like the cut, size, quantity and so on.  You will be able to order any combination of sizes per kit/color.  For now please just choose your reward and we will deliver a New Kit Day.
Beautify The Peloton
That's our mission! Please help us out and get a great kit in return. If this Kickstarter is successful we can launch our next few designs in the coming months. We have some amazing kits coming soon. So join us and let's make it a New Kit Day!

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Why we are relaunching: We set a high goal because we needed to order enough materials to get the pricing we wanted. Since launching the project our vendors have a better understanding of our business plan and they are willing to extend the 'bulk' pricing to us on smaller orders. This is because they expect us to order another batch next month and the month after and the month after. Anyway, we convinced them that in the long-run we will get to the number we need. So that's basically it, we raised just under $13K before, so we set the goal there. Let's do this! 

Thankfully our risks and challenges are fairly few and minor. New Kit Day is producing everything right here in the San Francisco Bay Area. We oversee the whole process. Here are some possible risks and mitigation.

Production Time - Typically is takes 4 to 6 weeks to produce and ship custom clothing depending on the number of other projects currently manufacturing at the facility. Since we have a professional designer our layouts will be production ready. We also handle the ordering process, so our deposits and shipping information will also be ready before production is completed. This should cut down on overall production time.

Materials & Chamois - We have samples of all the materials and chamois already and New Kit Day will review the actual kits coming off the line to make sure all the materials, workmanship and quality stay top notch.

Shipping - Our order will ship directly to the customer from the production facility with tracking information.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Thanks for an amazing campaign!
Follow the game and get involved!
www.massivechalice.com
http://www.doublefine.com/forums/
For Paypal, Bitcoin, and Slacker Backer options, head to: http://www.massivechalice.com/back/
If turn-based tactics and feudal fantasy had a lovechild, and that offspring founded a mighty century-spanning dynasty, it would be MASSIVE CHALICE.
With your help, MASSIVE CHALICE will become a reality—forged by Double Fine with our 3D in-house Buddha Engine and unleashed on Windows, Mac, and Linux.
Battling alongside ancestors (early concept)
We're inspired by classic tactical strategy games like X-COM, Final Fantasy Tactics, and Fire Emblem, as well as Game of Thrones’ array of noble families. With these influences in mind we’re creating an epic, replayable turn-based tactics game where you train generations of heroes to repel a demonic invasion.
And with Kickstarter, we can do it. We have a great concept and team ready to go, and we want to work closely with our community to control the future of MASSIVE CHALICE free from outside interference.
MASSIVE CHALICE is a single player turn-based tactics game within a multi-generational strategy campaign built for replayability.
As an immortal King or Queen, you must unite your kingdom under a powerful dynasty, eliminate the demonic threat, and reforge the MASSIVE CHALICE!
The game is structured into two main layers: strategy and tactics. In the strategy layer, you oversee your kingdom, arrange royal marriages, conduct research, and make the far-reaching decisions that will determine the fate of your legacy.
In the tactics layer, you fight brutal turn-based battles to defend your kingdom using small squads of customizable heroes.
Forest environment (early concept) - click for Hi-Res version
Permadeath is inevitable: your heroes will grow, age, and eventually die. You'll have to choose between keeping your favorite heroes on the battlefield or retiring them from combat to foster a new generation of warriors.
A Hero (early concept)
Drawing from roguelikes we love, content is modular and randomized. Each playthrough begins with a random assortment of male and female heroes from various bloodlines, guaranteeing that each game is unique. Your knowledge and skill will increase over multiple playthroughs, but the details of every game will change based on your decisions and the whims of fate.
Strategic map (early concept)
Core Game Features
Your story emerges as you defend against attacks, complete quests, and respond to randomized events in your attempt to preserve the kingdom.
Line of sight and fog of war mechanics come into play as your squad explores beautiful dynamic 3D battlefields where danger may lurk behind any corner.
Distinct, customizable heroes learn new melee, ranged, and arcane abilities as they age and gain combat experience.
Arrange marriage alliances to ensure your heroic bloodlines can handle any future combat situation.
Battle alongside your ancestors by equipping your heroes with uniquely powerful Bloodline Relics.
Invest your resources in forging new weapons and armor—and gamble on polluting a bloodline by researching dangerous demonic artifacts.

Another Double Fine Kickstarter?
Last year, you Kickstarted Double Fine Adventure, shattering records and bringing video games to the Kickstarter spotlight! Now known as Broken Age, that game is in full production and is already a beautiful and unique experience—but the Broken Age team only represents a third of our multi-game studio.
Double Fine’s goal is for all our teams to remain independent and responsible directly to their players. Kickstarting MASSIVE CHALICE allows us to maintain a pure creative vision, put out updates on our own schedule, respond to feedback without roadblocks, and release it all DRM-free.
Where are your stretch goals?
This Kickstarter is clean and simple. We’re asking for the minimum amount to make an awesome game, and the game’s scope will grow based on the amount of total backing we receive. There will be ongoing conversations with the community as new features are considered, so stay tuned and let us know what you'd like to see in the game!
For MASSIVE CHALICE we’re getting back to basics and focusing on the project itself. We’re a team passionate about turn-based strategy, and we want to craft a new Double Fine world by partnering with you!
Limited edition poster designed by Cory Schmitz
Limited edition t-shirt designed by Cory Schmitz
2 Player Productions is well known to Double Fine fans as the awesome team of filmmakers behind the Double Fine Adventure and Amnesia Fortnight documentary series.
It turns out they aren't sick of us yet! If the project is funded, 2 Player will be able to create a series of development diaries chronicling the creation of MASSIVE CHALICE. These will be released to the general public, but backers will also get exclusive access to high-quality HD downloadable versions ($50 tier and above).
Project Lead: Brad Muir
MASSIVE CHALICE is helmed by Brad Muir, creator of Iron Brigade, the fan-favorite tower defense mech shooter. A longtime Double Fine veteran, Brad served as a programmer on Psychonauts and a designer on Brütal Legend. Brad is a turn-based strategy and roguelike fanatic, and is the friendliest guy you'll ever meet! :D!
Double Fine Productions is an award-winning, independent game development studio founded in 2000 by games industry veteran Tim Schafer. Located in San Francisco’s South of Market district, Double Fine is committed to making high-quality games with an emphasis on originality, story, characters, and fun.
The MASSIVE CHALICE team comprises artists, designers, and engineers who recently worked on Double Fine projects like The Cave, Brütal Legend PC, Dropchord, Middle Manager of Justice, and various prototypes. The crew is ready to work on something big. Something MASSIVE.
The Buddha Engine
MASSIVE CHALICE is being developed with Buddha, our versatile in-house 3D engine first created for Brütal Legend. We know Buddha like the back of our hand—because our hand is coded in C++, scripted in Lua, and rigged with Maya.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
MASSIVE CHALICE is a new kind of game from Double Fine, but that’s what makes it perfect for Kickstarter, a place where new ideas can be given a chance by passionate fans. We believe we can find a substantial audience for this unique combination of strategy, squad tactics, and multi-generational gameplay.

MASSIVE CHALICE is still in its earliest stages, so its backers will join us for every phase of development. We're tackling a new genre for Double Fine, but building on our years of experience making games of all types with our own technology.

Games are complicated and expensive projects, but MASSIVE CHALICE has been scoped appropriately for our fundraising goal. By targeting open PC platforms and relying on a modular game design, we can create a core experience and build on it over time. The more backing we receive, the more systems and content we can create, and the better the game will be!

Most importantly, we're passionate about what Double Fine can bring to fantasy tactics games, and we're dedicated to rewarding our community with the best game possible.

So please support MASSIVE CHALICE, spread the news, and join us on our journey!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Dat Ass Up.
This project is based on the auto-tweet Kickstarter generates when you back a project. The tweet reads "I just backed (blank) project on Kickstarter."
 I recently realized that gaming the automated tweet could be both interesting, and fun, and that referencing Juvenile's 1999 summer hit "Back Dat Ass Up" would be the perfect way to hack the system. 
This is a project to fulfill my dream of an automated tweet that reads "I just backed Dat Ass Up on Kickstarter."

Well, the project was created as part of a hack day, and the project was to hack the automated tweet generated when you back a project on Kickstarter. By backing this project, and generating the auto "____ just backed Dat Ass Up" tweet, and subsequently tweeting, we all completed the project. This project was about tweaking really mundane everyday things (auto-generated tweets) and making them say something funny that might make you lol. I'd say we were all successful.

campaign.story:
My name is Ondi Timoner, documentary film director of DIG!, WE LIVE IN PUBLIC, Join Us, and Cool It.  I've won the Sundance Film Festival Grand-Jury prize twice - once for DIG! in 2004, and again five years later for We Live In Public.  Both of these films now reside in the permanent collection of the MoMA NY.  It’s been a wild ride, and I have been blessed to shoot these stories and share them around the world. 
And the adventure continues:  My team and I have spent the last two years interviewing some of the most influential minds in technology for our web portal, A Total Disruption. I set out to do this, because I am fascinated by the people and ideas that are changing and shaping our lives each and every day. Tech innovation moves so fast that we’ve struggled to keep pace with all the riveting content. We have managed to collect 300 hours of footage and put out 50 episodes so far.  And now we really, really need your help.
I’m asking for your support, so I can keep bringing you these vital stories, and enhance your experience with them in even more empowering ways.  This project has been super-punk so far, but we’ve outgrown ourselves. 
Why did I begin this amazing journey? Why am I passionately distributing these stories for free? Because I realized that we are living in the midst of the greatest revolution in human history, but the stories of this unprecedented era of innovation are not being told in ways that everyone can enjoy, understand, and connect with. And so I've turned my lens on this oft-intimidating industry, and its infinitely inspiring leaders, to empower all of us to get smarter and faster, together. By sharing our stories, we can all learn how to make our own visions fly, or figure out how to make a life doing what we love. There is an unprecedented opportunity right now, and I want us all to have the power and knowledge to seize it.
So far we’ve interviewed over 100 captivating innovators and entrepreneurs. During the past two years, we chased down the best minds changing the world through technology, media and entertainment. And there are so many more stories we want to tell!
HELP US BRING THESE STORIES TO YOU!
Viva La Disrupción!
- Ondi Timoner, A Total Disruption
Who Have We Interviewed?
Notable episodes include Alexis Ohanian of Reddit, Kevin Systrom of Instagram, Tony Hsieh of Zappos, Bram Cohen of Bit Torrent, and Reid Hoffman of LinkedIn, all of which can be found at atotaldisruption.com as part of seven unique web series.
GOAL #1 - THE EPISODES
Right now, we have 50 completed and edited interviews in 7 different web series that you can watch RIGHT NOW at www.atotaldisruption.com. But that’s just the tip of the iceberg, people. We have over 100 additional interviews that we have yet to edit, and every day we learn about another dynamic innovation that requires investigation. IF we are successful with this campaign, we'll be interviewing Jack Dorsey (Founder of Twitter and Square) and other chief disruptors in San Francisco next month! 
History is happening around us right now, and we are determined to make sure that we capture it, and transform it into something we can all learn and benefit from. By supporting ATD, you will guarantee that we continue to produce at least one episode a week of groundbreaking tech innovation to feed the innovator in you.
GOAL #2 - THE DATABASE
We are creating a never-before-seen repository for the stories of technology, as they unfold, accessible through one singular online portal.
We know a web series episode can only tell so much of the story. For every 5 minute video we produce, we film between 1 and 2 full hours of each subject as they convey a wealth of valuable information and insight. The solution: We will convert these hundreds of hours of interviews into a highly searchable database where all of the experience and knowledge of the biggest minds in tech will be at your fingertips.
Learn in detail about every aspect of their experience from what motivates them, to their successes, failures, and everything in between. Tech fans, innovators, entrepreneurs, venture capitalists, schools, universities, and historians will be able to plunder this knowledge database for years to come. It can become a time-capsule of the revolution we are still experiencing in our lives each and every day. 
GOAL #3 - THE NEW CEA SERIES - Season One: Amanda Palmer
Who is Amanda Palmer? Not only is she an epic musician (best known for The Dresden Dolls), but she had one of the most successful individual campaigns on Kickstarter, raising over 1.1 million dollars to produce her next album. Wow! How did she do it? She harnessed the power of social media and the enthusiasm of her devoted fan base - not just for her art, but for her inspired mission to change the way the game is played.
If this campaign is successful, we will launch a unique new series called CEA (Chief Executive Artist), taking a look at innovators in the fields of art and music. We will begin by chronicling Amanda's next world tour - which is dedicated to playing for the fans that contributed to her unparalleled crowdfunding success. By leveraging technology to become a successful CEA, she turns the business into an art form in and of itself. Amanda's story is one everyone can learn from and reproduce-- a singular story that represents the larger zeitgeist in which we all live.
Once the series gets kicking, we will release these episodes on A Total Disruption every week - following Amanda's tour of house parties, Ninja Gigs, and many other disruptive events to be revealed. The more money we raise here, the further we can go - both geographically and in terms of number of episodes!
Share This Campaign!
Facebook: www.facebook.com/ATotalDisruption
Twitter:  www.twitter.com/TotalDisruption
Thank You, Disruptors!
I hope you will become a part of the documentation of the disruption, one of the biggest shifts in human history. I look forward to the other side of this campaign, empowered to bring the revolution to you!!!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
A note from the Interloper Team: On the spectrum of risk, A Total Disruption has remarkably little risk of not being completed. First off, you have one of the most successful, hardworking, and determined documentary filmmakers in the world directing the effort. Ondi's track record speaks for itself: http://www.imdb.com/name/nm0863756/

For the database, our editors are ready to begin the steps of transcoding, cataloguing, tagging, and uploading the hundreds of hours of interviews onto our servers. All of this is professionally budgeted and thought out to ensure success!

If we reach our fundraising goal, our now eight series (we're including the new CEA: Amanda Palmer adventure) will continue, and with a few new and key crew members joining the team, so that our database can soon gift the world with unmatchable quality wisdom. Please do believe in and support ATD. You will become a part of a project that may indeed become film history, chronicling the disruption you're now a part of!!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
As seen in The Wall Street Journal, The Jewish Daily Forward, Bowery Boogie, Heeb Magazine, Tablet Magazine, Food Republic, The Baltimore Jewish Times, The Village Voice, and more...
We did it! YOU did it!!! Go Team Matzo!
We are absolutely stunned and grateful beyond words for the support you've given us for the past 45 days.  We're in shock, to be honest, at the outpouring of support as the campaign draws to a close tonight - thank you all, from the bottom of our hearts, thank you!!!! It is ALL because of you, your belief in us, and in this story. Thank you!!!!
We're setting a STRETCH GOAL!
With 10 hours left, we're setting a stretch goal at $90,000!  Don't worry, we've hit the goal we set, so no chance now of your pledges not being counted!  Here's the deal:  The original budget for this film was $125,000.  Can we make an awesome film for $60,000? Yes!!! And we're going to, thanks to you!  But while we have time, we're continuing to raise funds for marketing the film - getting it out to festivals, meeting with distributors, publicizing the project once it's finished.  It's a huge part of the process!  We're forever grateful for the opportunity you've given us, for your support that's allowed us to make this film.  Let's keep sharing it today and see how far we can go!  Above all else, again....
THANK YOU!!!!!
THE STORY 
On Manhattan’s Lower East Side, in a series of four nondescript brick tenement buildings, sits the Streit’s Matzo factory.  In 1925, when Aron Streit opened the factory’s doors, it sat at the heart of the nations largest Jewish immigrant community. Today, in its fifth generation of family ownership, in a rapidly gentrifying Lower East Side, it remains as the last family owned matzo factory in America. 
This is place rooted in history and tradition, and not only in the sense that the recipe for their product is 3,000 years old.  The machinery still used here to bake and pack 40% of the nation’s matzo is as old as the factory itself.  The owners still sit at their great grandfathers desks, declining to clear the drawers of the contents left by their forbearers.   They have, again and again, refused exorbitant sums offered by developers for their real estate, and resisted modernizing the facility, worried at the potential effects on their fiercely loyal workforce, made up of neighborhood residents and immigrants from around the world, many of whom have been working there for 30 years or more.  
And yet, while in many ways Streit’s may seem a relic from another age, they continue to thrive, consistently receiving more orders than they can fill. 
In a neighborhood where the Jewish immigrants have long ago moved on, in a nation where progress and profits trump all else, where manufacturing has left the cities if not the country, where family businesses are bought out by giant corporations and workers move from job to low paying job, Streit’s remains a Lower East Side institution, and a glimmer of hope for the American Dream. 
THE FILM 
This film, a feature-length documentary, will tell the story of Streit’s - of the factory, of the family, of its workers, of its place in the rich history of the Lower East Side and in America.   It is a story of tradition, of resilience and resistance, of the perseverance of the Jewish people, and of immigrants of all faiths, so many of whom have found home in the Lower East Side, behind the doors of Streit’s, or in the matzo they bake.
The film is being directed by Lower East Side-based documentary filmmaker Michael Levine, and produced by Michael Green (see the FAQ for more about the production team).
WE NEED YOUR HELP! 
By joining in our Kickstarter campaign, you can help us get this film made! 
As you can see from the teaser, we’ve begun production, and the experience has been amazing!  The owners of Streit’s and everyone who works at the factory are extremely excited about the project, and helping out every way they can to help us capture their story.  
But to this point, the production has been self-financed, and that can only take us so far.  A feature length documentary is a major undertaking, and we need to raise money to complete the film (see the FAQ below to learn more about where the funding will go).
With your support on Kickstarter, and by spreading the word about the project, we will be able to finish the film and get the Streit’s story out into the world.
BE REWARDED FOR YOUR SUPPORT!
Not only will your pledge help us tell Streit's amazing story, but it'll get you some pretty nifty rewards as well... Posters of vintage Streit's advertising, the hats worn by workers at the Streit's factory (well, the same type of hat, we're don't plan on sending you a used hat unless you really want it), tours of the factory with the owners and the film's director, gift packages from Streit's, festival passes, and of course the finished film itself!  Check out all the reward levels available on the right...
And for those outside the United States, while the rewards say "Ships within the US only, we are happy to ship internationally!  Please just add $10 to your pledge for shipping, and send us a note letting us know that your reward will need to be shipped outside the United States.  Thank you!
HOW DOES KICKSTARTER WORK? 
Through Kickstarter, you can make a pledge to help us reach our funding goal, and we offer you rewards for your support.  If we reach our goal within our 45 day fundraising period, we receive the donation you pledged and you receive your reward. If our goal is not reached, no money changes hands and the film remains unfunded.  It’s all or nothing! 
CAN WE EXCEED OUR GOAL? 
Yes! In fact, as thrilled as we would be to reach our goal of $60,000, and as much as those funds will allow us to do, exceeding that amount would be of huge benefit to the production of the film, and to you.  And here’s why… 
As for the filming, we’re not too worried about going hungry – we’re in a matzo factory, after all.  But when it comes to licensing archival footage, music, and other materials, spending the time it takes to really edit a feature-length film, making the final product truly worthy of the Streit’s mark of quality, the extra money goes a very long way, so we’re setting our sights high! 
HOW ELSE CAN I HELP?
The most important part of a Kickstarter campaign (aside from reaching our funding goal, of course!) is getting the word out.  We’re doing everything we can to let people know about the project, but we could sure use your help!  So, tweet about it, like us on facebook and post about it, tell your friends and family about our Kickstarter page.  Do you run a blog? A student paper?  The New York Times?  Get in touch!  We and the folks at Streit’s are always available for interviews.  It all helps!
GET IN TOUCH!
Have a question that's not answered here?  Looking to do a story about the film? Email us anytime at matzofilm@gmail.com.  We look forward to hearing from you!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Any feature length film production has it's challenges, but we are completely confident in our ability to complete this documentary and deliver the rewards to our supporters. We are on track with filming as we speak, the filmmaker has a strong track record in film and television of delivering projects on time and on budget, and all involved in this project, including the owners and workers at Streit's are extremely passionate about the film. We are completely committed and will work day and night (because that's what filmmakers do!) to deliver a film that captures the spirit, the history, the story of Streit's and the Lower East Side.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

Hey Team Matzo! 
Tomorrow is the day we’ve been waiting for… 
Streit’s: Matzo and the American Dream Opens in Theaters in New York and Los Angeles, April 20th! 
SCREENING DATES/LOCATIONS & TICKET INFO:

Greeting Team Matzo!   
We realize it’s been a long while since our last update, and we have much to fill you in on!   
NYC Theatrical Release   
Streit’s: Matzo and the American Dream will be playing at NYC’s Film Forum April 20th-26th, 2016 – just in time for Passover!  Never in our wildest dreams did we imagine when we started this project that it would one day be playing at New York’s most prestigious independent theater, and we are so thrilled and grateful for the opportunity.  The film will be screening six times per day during the week, with Q&As with the Streit family and special guests, plus matzo giveaways all week long.  We very much hope you can join us and spread the word!

Hey Team Matzo! 
For our supporters in the New York area who would like to see the film on the big screen, we want remind you that it will be screening this coming Tuesday, April 7th, at 6pm and 8pm, at the JCC Manhattan. 
We will be there, along with members of the Streit family, for a Q&A session after each screening, plus, (in case you haven’t had your fill by then…), everyone who attends will receive a free box of Streit’s Matzos!

Hey Team Matzo! 
It’s been an incredibly exciting few weeks for the film, and lots more coming up, including our theatrical release through Menemsha Films! 
The film premiered two weeks ago at the Atlanta Jewish Film Festival, and we were absolutely thrilled to be there for Q&A sessions following our screenings – and had the pleasure of meeting another member of the Streit family, Phil Yagoda, the younger brother of owner Aron Yagoda, who joined us for our post-screening Q&A’s.

Hey Team Matzo,
While we continue to come to terms with the news that Streit's will be leaving our beloved Lower East Side after Passover, we do have some very exciting news on the film front to report...
DISTRIBUTION!

Dear Team Matzo, 
We are truly in shock and devastated to report that the Streit’s Matzo factory will permanently close its doors at the conclusion of this year’s Passover baking season. 
You can read the report we sent today to the Lower East Side blog Bowery Boogie detailing the factory’s imminent closure here:

campaign.story:
About The Project:
Horse Cycles is a custom bicycle builder in Brooklyn, NY. We seek your funding to purchase the tools and materials we need to begin manufacturing a line of all American production bicycles. Our goal is to offer a high quality locally crafted alternative to foreign imports.
As a custom bicycle manufacturer, we have significant experience in tailoring bicycles to our clients needs. We bring this same bespoke attention to design and detail to this new line of production bikes. Each will be built with the same high quality materials and techniques we use for many of our custom bikes.
We will use the proceeds from our Kickstarter campaign to acquire the additional machinery we need to move into larger scale production. This new equipment will enable us to manufacture bikes faster, offering them at a more competitive price. 
About The Bike:
The first of these production bikes will be called the Urban Tour. It will be made in-house at the Horse Cycles workshop using machinery we will be purchasing with the proceeds of this campaign.
This new bike is designed as a versatile all-rounder, perfect for light touring, city riding and commuting. The frame will be made from all U.S. sourced materials including high quality True Temper double-butted 4130 steel alloy. This paired with our TIG welded construction and lugged fork produces a responsive, lightweight and durable bicycle that will last a lifetime.
Each bike comes equipped with cantilever brake mounts, water bottle bosses, and rack / fender mounts, making it a versatile and rugged do anything bicycle. By producing the frames in-house we can ensure the highest quality. Ride it to your local farmers market, down to the beach, or load it up for a cross-country tour.
Once the Kickstarter campaign is completed we will be contacting supporters to confirm sizing and color choices. Don’t hesitate to reach out through the comments section for more details. We will be providing regular updates and some great footage and photo’s as we go into production, through delivery.

Additional Specs:
Sizes: 58cm, 55cm, 52cm with 700c wheels and a 48cm 650b step-through version (see sizing and geometry below)
Durable powder coat finish with hand painted lug lining on the fork crown.
Offered in 4 different colors: Blue, Cream, Black and Green.
Mounts for cantilever brakes that provide increased stopping power and fender clearance.
Water bottle, rack, and fender mounts.
Horizontal dropouts with derailleur hanger for single speed or multi speed set ups
Clearance for up to 45mm tires
Threadless 1" steerer tube
27.2 seat post clamp diameter

Aside from our new production bike, we have worked with a variety of local designers and makers in creating a great collection of incentive products. Each is a collaboration that is exclusive to the Urban Tour Project – shown in the images below.

Risks and challenges
Having manufactured custom bicycles for the past 7 years, we are confident in creating an extremely high quality product. As craftsmen, we are excited to start using the new machinery and equipment in producing this new line of production bicycles. 


Delivery date: This will depend on how many bicycles are ordered, but we plan to work fast! From the time the kickstarter ends, we project a delivery date by the end of May. 

Product changes: Though we think we have designed a wonderful bicycle frame we are open to suggestions, reasonable ones especially. We won’t promise that we will apply them all but we are always open to feedback. We would love to hear what you think of the project and changes you might suggest.

hmplvan@gmail.com
or
scotta.schneid@gmail.com
All the goods, bikes have been shipped out. Please let us know if you did not receive your goods. Once again thank you so much for your support! We are lunching a new storefront called horse brand Co. We will update you all when it’s live. All the best from the Horse Cycles Workshop.

updates.update_userinfo: HMPL Bags and Hats, Arriving later than expected.
updates.update_content:
Well, it’s been a busy few months since the kickstarter campaign. As soon as we hit our target we started preparing orders for the new equipment we would need to move into production, and for all the materials we'd need to manufacture the urban tour bikes. 
We were able to invest the funds we raised in a Bridgeport milling machine, new jigs, TIG welding equipment a powder coating machine, an oven to bake the finished frames and lots more. We also ordered new storage for materials, tubing and frames.

updates.update_userinfo: Update on the bikes: 40 bikes in 2 months
updates.update_content:
Hi Everyone!
Firstly I want to thank all of you for you patience. As you can imagine, moving from custom manufacturing of bicycles to a production line has taken much of our attention. We are nearly finished producing the first run of 40 bicycles. Not bad considering we only took delivery of the new machinery last month. 
We are making solid progress on all the other rewards so I wanted to share a status on each for you. We definitely underestimated how long it will take to get some of the rewards out.

THANK YOU THANK YOU THANK YOU!!
Firstly I wanted to apologize for not writing you sooner. We are now in full swing preparing for manufacturing so I have been super busy at the workshop. Lot's of fun updates to come i promise.
I just wanted to say a huge THANK YOU for all the incredible support and kindness we have received since we started this ride. The team at Horse Cycles are truly grateful to all of you and can't wait to send out all your fun rewards.

We hit our goal, and to celebrate we've created two awesome new rewards!
TOTE BY MER BAGS. Since we started this adventure, everyone has asked us to put out a tote bag. There are way too many standard totes out there, so we decided to do it right. We collaborated with Rob from Mer Bags and came up with a super functional design. It's over sized so you can carry lots of stuff, and has a shoulder strap so you can take it on tour. Hand made in Bushwick from durable vinyl coated polyester it's perfect for on and off the bike. Shoulder strap and center pocket. Very functional!

updates.update_userinfo: Funded!! Thank you for all of your support.
updates.update_content:
We Hit our Goal!  Hurray!  Lets push The Urban Tour Project to the MAX!  

As a thank you we are giving away a free Hand Printed T-Shirt for every pledge made over  $100 Bucks! Past and Future pledges!
Thanks for your continued support.  Keep spreading the word and sharing with your friends.  Facebook has been really amazing for getting the word out there so thanks to all who have posted.
